hints.title: SO(10) Connection from Algorithmic Dynamics
hints.content:
3127: :label: thm-so10-connection-derivation
3128: 
3129: The SO(10) gauge connection $A_{AB}^\mu(n_{i,t})$ stored on CST edges is derived from the Fragile Gas algorithmic operators. The connection decomposes into subgroup components corresponding to the algorithmic forces.
3130: 
3131: **Complete Derivation:**
3132: 
3133: **Step 1: Identify Algorithmic Sources**
3134: 
3135: From `01_fractal_set.md` §7, the three algorithmic gauge symmetries are:
3136: 
3137: | **Gauge Group** | **Algorithmic Origin** | **Data Structure** | **Section** |
3138: |-----------------|------------------------|-------------------|-------------|
3139: | **U(1)_fitness** | Diversity companion selection | Diversity phase $\theta_{ik}^{(\text{U}(1))}$ | §7.6 |
3140: | **SU(2)_weak** | Cloning companion selection | Cloning phase $\theta_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))}$ | §7.10 |
3141: | **SU(3)_color** | Viscous force vector | Force-velocity encoding $\mathbf{c}_i \in \mathbb{C}^3$ | §7.13 |
3142: 
3143: **Step 2: SU(2)_weak Connection from Cloning**
3144: 
3145: The SU(2) connection arises from walker evolution under cloning interaction. From §7.10, the cloning phase is:
3146: 
3147: $$
3148: \theta_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))} = -\frac{d_{\text{alg}}(i,j)^2}{2\epsilon_c^2 \hbar_{\text{eff}}}
3149: 
3150: $$
3151: 
3152: The SU(2) link variable (parallel transport operator) is:
3153: 
3154: $$
3155: U_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))} = \exp(i\theta_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))} \mathbf{n}_{ij} \cdot \boldsymbol{\sigma})
3156: 
3157: $$
3158: 
3159: where $\mathbf{n}_{ij}$ is the unit vector in algorithmic space and $\boldsymbol{\sigma} = (\sigma^1, \sigma^2, \sigma^3)$ are Pauli matrices.
3160: 
3161: **Continuous connection** from discrete link:
3162: 
3163: $$
3164: A^{SU(2)}_\mu(x_i) = \frac{1}{\Delta x_\mu} \log U_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))} = \frac{i\theta_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2)}}{\Delta x_\mu} \mathbf{n}_{ij} \cdot \boldsymbol{\sigma}
3165: 
3166: $$
3167: 
3168: where $\Delta x_\mu = x_j^\mu - x_i^\mu$ is the spacetime displacement.
3169: 
3170: **Component form** (3 components for SU(2)):
3171: 
3172: $$
3173: A^{SU(2), a}_\mu = -\frac{d_{\text{alg}}(i,j)^2}{2\epsilon_c^2 \hbar_{\text{eff}}} \cdot \frac{n_{ij}^a}{\|\mathbf{x}_{ij}\|}, \quad a = 1,2,3
3174: 
3175: $$
3176: 
3177: where $n_{ij}^a$ are components of the unit vector in isospin space.
3178: 
3179: **Step 3: SU(3)_color Connection from Viscous Force**
3180: 
3181: From §7.13, the SU(3) gauge field components are derived from the emergent metric via Christoffel symbols:
3182: 
3183: $$
3184: A_{ij}^{a} = \text{Tr}\left[\lambda_a \cdot \Gamma(x_i, x_j)\right]
3185: 
3186: $$
3187: 
3188: where $\lambda_a$ (a=1,...,8) are Gell-Mann matrices and $\Gamma(x_i, x_j)$ is the finite-difference Christoffel symbol matrix.
3189: 
3190: **Explicit formula:**
3191: 
3192: $$
3193: A^{SU(3), a}_\mu = \text{Tr}\left[\lambda_a \cdot g^{\nu\lambda} \partial_\mu g_{\nu\lambda}\right]
3194: 
3195: $$
3196: 
3197: This encodes how the viscous force vector $\mathbf{F}_{\text{visc}}$ couples to walker velocities through the metric geometry.
3198: 
3199: **Step 4: U(1)_fitness Is Global (Not Gauged)**
3200: 
3201: From §7.6, U(1)_fitness is a **global symmetry**:
3202: 
3203: $$
3204: \theta_{ik}^{(\text{U}(1))} = -\frac{d_{\text{alg}}(i,k)^2}{2\epsilon_d^2 \hbar_{\text{eff}}} = \text{const.} \quad \text{(same for all walkers)}
3205: 
3206: $$
3207: 
3208: This gives a **Noether current** $J^\mu_{\text{fitness}}$ but **no gauge connection** (global phase, not local gauge field).
3209: 
3210: **Step 5: Gravity Sector from Christoffel Symbols**
3211: 
3212: From §7.14, the gravitational sector is encoded via the Christoffel symbols stored on CST edges:
3213: 
3214: $$
3215: \Gamma^\lambda_{\mu\nu}(n_{i,t}) = \frac{1}{2}g^{\lambda\rho}\left(\partial_\mu g_{\nu\rho} + \partial_\nu g_{\rho\mu} - \partial_\rho g_{\mu\nu}\right)
3216: 
3217: $$
3218: 
3219: The spin connection (SO(1,3) gauge field for fermions) is:
3220: 
3221: $$
3222: \omega_{\mu}^{ab} = e_\nu^a \partial_\mu e^{\nu b} + e_\nu^a \Gamma^\nu_{\mu\lambda} e^{\lambda b}
3223: 
3224: $$
3225: 
3226: where $e_\mu^a$ are the vielbein (frame fields).
3227: 
3228: **Step 6: Full SO(10) Connection Assembly**
3229: 
3230: The SO(10) connection $A_{AB}^\mu$ with indices $A, B \in \{0,1,\ldots,9\}$ decomposes as:
3231: 
3232: $$
3233: A_{AB}^\mu = \begin{cases}
3234: \omega_\mu^{01}, \omega_\mu^{02}, \omega_\mu^{03}, \omega_\mu^{12}, \omega_\mu^{13}, \omega_\mu^{23} & \text{Lorentz (6 components, } A,B \in \{0,1,2,3\}) \\
3235: A^{SU(2), a}_\mu & \text{Weak isospin (3 components, from indices } \{1,2,3\}) \\
3236: A^{SU(3), a}_\mu & \text{Color (8 components, from indices } \{5,6,7,8,9,10\}) \\
3237: 0 & \text{Broken generators (24 X,Y bosons, massive)}
3238: \end{cases}
3239: 
3240: $$
3241: 
3242: **Explicit index map** (corrected from embeddings in §4-6):
3243: 
3244: | **SO(10) Indices $A, B$** | **Subgroup** | **Components** | **Algorithmic Source** |
3245: |---------------------------|--------------|----------------|------------------------|
3246: | $(0,1), (0,2), (0,3)$ | SO(1,3) boosts | 3 | Spin connection $\omega$ |
3247: | $(1,2), (1,3), (2,3)$ | SO(3) rotations | 3 | Spatial spin connection |
3248: | $(1,2), (1,3), (2,3)$ | SU(2)_L weak | 3 | Cloning phases $\theta_{ij}^{(\text{SU}(2))}$ |
3249: | $(5,6), (5,7), \ldots, (9,10)$ | SU(3) color | 8 | Viscous force Christoffel projection |
3250: | Other pairs | Broken X, Y bosons | 24 | Set to zero (GUT scale broken) |
3251: 
3252: **Step 7: Consistency with Spinor Storage**
3253: 
3254: The full 16-spinor $|\Psi_i\rangle \in \mathbb{C}^{16}$ (from §7.15) transforms under the SO(10) connection:
3255: 
3256: $$
3257: \frac{d|\Psi_i\rangle}{dt} = -i \sum_{A<B} A_{AB}^\mu(x_i) \frac{dx_i^\mu}{dt} T^{AB} |\Psi_i\rangle
3258: 
3259: $$
3260: 
3261: where $T^{AB}$ are the 45 SO(10) generators from {prf:ref}`thm-so10-lie-algebra`.
3262:

3269: 
3270: The SO(10) unified coupling at the GUT scale is related to algorithmic parameters via:
3271: 
3272: $$
3273: \alpha_{\text{GUT}} = \frac{g_{\text{GUT}}^2}{4\pi} \sim \frac{\hbar_{\text{eff}}^2}{\epsilon_c \epsilon_d}
3274: 
3275: $$
3276: 
3277: where:
3278: - $\epsilon_c$: Cloning interaction range → SU(2) weak coupling
3279: - $\epsilon_d$: Diversity measurement range → U(1) fitness (global)
3280: - $\hbar_{\text{eff}}$: Effective Planck constant
3281: 
3282: At the GUT scale, the three couplings unify:
3283: 
3284: $$
3285: \alpha_1(M_{\text{GUT}}) = \alpha_2(M_{\text{GUT}}) = \alpha_3(M_{\text{GUT}}) = \alpha_{\text{GUT}}
3286: 
3287: $$
3288: 
3289: This imposes consistency constraints on the algorithmic parameters.

hints.label: thm-so10-field-strength
hints.title: SO(10) Field Strength Tensor
hints.content:
3314: :label: thm-so10-field-strength
3315: 
3316: The field strength tensor for SO(10) gauge theory is:
3317: 
3318: $$
3319: \mathcal{F}_{AB}^{\mu\nu} = \partial^\mu A_{AB}^\nu - \partial^\nu A_{AB}^\mu + \sum_{CD} [A^\mu, A^\nu]_{AB}^{CD}
3320: 
3321: $$
3322: 
3323: where the commutator term uses SO(10) structure constants.
3324: 
3325: **Proof:**
3326: 
3327: This is a standard result in Yang-Mills gauge theory. We derive it from the covariant derivative and verify its transformation properties.
3328: 
3329: **Step 1: Definition from Covariant Derivative**
3330: 
3331: The covariant derivative in the SO(10) gauge theory is:
3332: 
3333: $$
3334: D_\mu = \partial_\mu + i A_\mu
3335: 
3336: $$
3337: 
3338: where $A_\mu = \sum_{A<B} A_{AB}^\mu T^{AB}$ is the gauge connection (sum over 45 generators).
3339: 
3340: The field strength tensor is defined as the commutator of covariant derivatives:
3341: 
3342: $$
3343: [D_\mu, D_\nu] = i\mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu}
3344: 
3345: $$
3346: 
3347: **Explicit calculation:**
3348: 
3349: $$
3350: \begin{aligned}
3351: [D_\mu, D_\nu] &= (\partial_\mu + iA_\mu)(\partial_\nu + iA_\nu) - (\partial_\nu + iA_\nu)(\partial_\mu + iA_\mu) \\
3352: &= \partial_\mu \partial_\nu + i\partial_\mu A_\nu + iA_\mu \partial_\nu + i^2 A_\mu A_\nu \\
3353: &\quad - \partial_\nu \partial_\mu - i\partial_\nu A_\mu - iA_\nu \partial_\mu - i^2 A_\nu A_\mu \\
3354: &= i(\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu) - (A_\mu A_\nu - A_\nu A_\mu) \\
3355: &= i\left(\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]\right)
3356: \end{aligned}
3357: 
3358: $$
3359: 
3360: Therefore, the field strength tensor is:
3361: 
3362: $$
3363: \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = \partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]
3364: 
3365: $$
3366: 
3367: **In component form** (using $A_\mu = \sum_{A<B} A_{AB}^\mu T^{AB}$):
3368: 
3369: $$
3370: \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = \sum_{A<B} F_{AB}^{\mu\nu} T^{AB}
3371: 
3372: $$
3373: 
3374: where
3375: 
3376: $$
3377: F_{AB}^{\mu\nu} = \partial^\mu A_{AB}^\nu - \partial^\nu A_{AB}^\mu + i\sum_{C<D, E<F} f_{AB,CD,EF} A_{CD}^\mu A_{EF}^\nu
3378: 
3379: $$
3380: 
3381: and $f_{AB,CD,EF}$ are the structure constants of SO(10) from {prf:ref}`thm-so10-lie-algebra`.
3382: 
3383: **Step 2: Gauge Transformation Properties**
3384: 
3385: Under a gauge transformation $U(x) \in \text{SO}(10)$, the connection transforms as:
3386: 
3387: $$
3388: A'_\mu = U A_\mu U^{-1} - i(\partial_\mu U) U^{-1}
3389: 
3390: $$
3391: 
3392: The field strength transforms covariantly:
3393: 
3394: $$
3395: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} = U \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} U^{-1}
3396: 
3397: $$
3398: 
3399: **Proof of transformation law:**
3400: 
3401: $$
3402: \begin{aligned}
3403: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} &= \partial_\mu A'_\nu - \partial_\nu A'_\mu + i[A'_\mu, A'_\nu] \\
3404: &= \partial_\mu(U A_\nu U^{-1} - i\partial_\nu U \cdot U^{-1}) - \partial_\nu(U A_\mu U^{-1} - i\partial_\mu U \cdot U^{-1}) \\
3405: &\quad + i[U A_\mu U^{-1} - i\partial_\mu U \cdot U^{-1}, U A_\nu U^{-1} - i\partial_\nu U \cdot U^{-1}] \\
3406: &= (\partial_\mu U) A_\nu U^{-1} + U (\partial_\mu A_\nu) U^{-1} + U A_\nu (\partial_\mu U^{-1}) \\
3407: &\quad - i(\partial_\mu \partial_\nu U) U^{-1} - i(\partial_\nu U)(\partial_\mu U^{-1}) \\
3408: &\quad - (\nu \leftrightarrow \mu) + i[U A_\mu U^{-1}, U A_\nu U^{-1}] + \text{[other commutator terms]}
3409: \end{aligned}
3410: 
3411: $$
3412: 
3413: Using the identity $\partial_\mu U^{-1} = -U^{-1} (\partial_\mu U) U^{-1}$ and simplifying (the derivative terms cancel due to $\partial_\mu \partial_\nu = \partial_\nu \partial_\mu$):
3414: 
3415: $$
3416: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} = U (\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]) U^{-1} = U \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} U^{-1}
3417: 
3418: $$
3419: 
3420: This confirms the field strength transforms in the **adjoint representation** of SO(10).
3421: 
3422: **Step 3: Bianchi Identity**
3423: 
3424: The field strength satisfies the **Bianchi identity** (follows from Jacobi identity):
3425: 
3426: $$
3427: D_\mu \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda} + D_\nu \mathcal{F}_{\lambda\mu} + D_\lambda \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = 0
3428: 
3429: $$
3430: 
3431: or equivalently:
3432: 
3433: $$
3434: \partial_\mu \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda} + i[A_\mu, \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda}] + \text{cyclic permutations} = 0
3435: 
3436: $$
3437:

3351: [D_\mu, D_\nu] &= (\partial_\mu + iA_\mu)(\partial_\nu + iA_\nu) - (\partial_\nu + iA_\nu)(\partial_\mu + iA_\mu) \\
3352: &= \partial_\mu \partial_\nu + i\partial_\mu A_\nu + iA_\mu \partial_\nu + i^2 A_\mu A_\nu \\
3353: &\quad - \partial_\nu \partial_\mu - i\partial_\nu A_\mu - iA_\nu \partial_\mu - i^2 A_\nu A_\mu \\
3354: &= i(\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu) - (A_\mu A_\nu - A_\nu A_\mu) \\
3355: &= i\left(\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]\right)
3356: \end{aligned}
3357: 
3358: $$
3359: 
3360: Therefore, the field strength tensor is:
3361: 
3362: $$
3363: \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = \partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]
3364: 
3365: $$
3366: 
3367: **In component form** (using $A_\mu = \sum_{A<B} A_{AB}^\mu T^{AB}$):
3368: 
3369: $$
3370: \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = \sum_{A<B} F_{AB}^{\mu\nu} T^{AB}
3371: 
3372: $$
3373: 
3374: where
3375: 
3376: $$
3377: F_{AB}^{\mu\nu} = \partial^\mu A_{AB}^\nu - \partial^\nu A_{AB}^\mu + i\sum_{C<D, E<F} f_{AB,CD,EF} A_{CD}^\mu A_{EF}^\nu
3378: 
3379: $$
3380: 
3381: and $f_{AB,CD,EF}$ are the structure constants of SO(10) from {prf:ref}`thm-so10-lie-algebra`.
3382: 
3383: **Step 2: Gauge Transformation Properties**
3384: 
3385: Under a gauge transformation $U(x) \in \text{SO}(10)$, the connection transforms as:
3386: 
3387: $$
3388: A'_\mu = U A_\mu U^{-1} - i(\partial_\mu U) U^{-1}
3389: 
3390: $$
3391: 
3392: The field strength transforms covariantly:
3393: 
3394: $$
3395: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} = U \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} U^{-1}
3396: 
3397: $$
3398: 
3399: **Proof of transformation law:**
3400: 
3401: $$
3402: \begin{aligned}
3403: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} &= \partial_\mu A'_\nu - \partial_\nu A'_\mu + i[A'_\mu, A'_\nu] \\
3404: &= \partial_\mu(U A_\nu U^{-1} - i\partial_\nu U \cdot U^{-1}) - \partial_\nu(U A_\mu U^{-1} - i\partial_\mu U \cdot U^{-1}) \\
3405: &\quad + i[U A_\mu U^{-1} - i\partial_\mu U \cdot U^{-1}, U A_\nu U^{-1} - i\partial_\nu U \cdot U^{-1}] \\
3406: &= (\partial_\mu U) A_\nu U^{-1} + U (\partial_\mu A_\nu) U^{-1} + U A_\nu (\partial_\mu U^{-1}) \\
3407: &\quad - i(\partial_\mu \partial_\nu U) U^{-1} - i(\partial_\nu U)(\partial_\mu U^{-1}) \\
3408: &\quad - (\nu \leftrightarrow \mu) + i[U A_\mu U^{-1}, U A_\nu U^{-1}] + \text{[other commutator terms]}
3409: \end{aligned}
3410: 
3411: $$
3412: 
3413: Using the identity $\partial_\mu U^{-1} = -U^{-1} (\partial_\mu U) U^{-1}$ and simplifying (the derivative terms cancel due to $\partial_\mu \partial_\nu = \partial_\nu \partial_\mu$):
3414: 
3415: $$
3416: \mathcal{F}'_{\mu\nu} = U (\partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu + i[A_\mu, A_\nu]) U^{-1} = U \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} U^{-1}
3417: 
3418: $$
3419: 
3420: This confirms the field strength transforms in the **adjoint representation** of SO(10).
3421: 
3422: **Step 3: Bianchi Identity**
3423: 
3424: The field strength satisfies the **Bianchi identity** (follows from Jacobi identity):
3425: 
3426: $$
3427: D_\mu \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda} + D_\nu \mathcal{F}_{\lambda\mu} + D_\lambda \mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} = 0
3428: 
3429: $$
3430: 
3431: or equivalently:
3432: 
3433: $$
3434: \partial_\mu \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda} + i[A_\mu, \mathcal{F}_{\nu\lambda}] + \text{cyclic permutations} = 0
3435: 
3436: $$
3437: 
3438: This is the gauge-covariant version of the classical electromagnetic Bianchi identity $\partial_{[\mu} F_{\nu\lambda]} = 0$.

3447: :label: thm-yang-mills-action-derivation
3448: 
3449: The SO(10) Yang-Mills action
3450: 
3451: $$
3452: S_{\text{YM}} = -\frac{1}{4g^2}\int d^4x \, \text{Tr}[\mathcal{F}_{\mu\nu} \mathcal{F}^{\mu\nu}]
3453: 
3454: $$
3455: 
3456: emerges as the continuum limit of the Fragile Gas cloning and kinetic operators acting on the discrete Fractal Set spacetime.
3457: 
3458: **Proof:**
3459: 
3460: We derive the Yang-Mills action in three stages: (1) construct SO(10) link variables from cloning amplitudes, (2) define the discrete Wilson plaquette action, (3) take the continuum limit.
3461:
